verses.kjv: O ye children of Benjamin, gather yourselves to flee out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and set up a sign of fire in Bethhaccerem: for evil appeareth out of the north, and great destruction.
verses.ct: Run for your lives, people of Benjamin! Get out of Jerusalem! Sound the trumpet in Tekoa and raise a signal fire in Beth-haccerem, because disaster is coming from the north — terrible destruction.

verses.kjv: I have likened the daughter of Zion to a comely and delicate woman.
verses.ct: I compared the daughter of Zion to a beautiful, delicate woman.

verses.kjv: The shepherds with their flocks shall come unto her; they shall pitch their tents against her round about; they shall feed every one in his place.
verses.ct: Shepherds will come against her with their flocks; they will set up camp all around her, and each one will graze his portion of the land.

verses.kjv: Prepare ye war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe unto us! for the day goeth away, for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.
verses.ct: "Get ready for war against her! Let's attack at midday!" "No — the day is slipping away, and the evening shadows are growing long."

verses.kjv: Arise, and let us go by night, and let us destroy her palaces.
verses.ct: "Then let's attack at night and tear down her fortresses!"

verses.kjv: For thus hath the LORD of hosts said, Hew ye down trees, and cast a mount against Jerusalem: this is the city to be visited; she is wholly oppression in the midst of her.
verses.ct: The LORD of hosts has said this: "Cut down her trees and build siege ramps against Jerusalem. This is the city that must be punished — she is filled with nothing but oppression."

verses.kjv: As a fountain casteth out her waters, so she casteth out her wickedness: violence and spoil is heard in her; before me continually is grief and wounds.
verses.ct: "Like a spring constantly pours out water, she constantly pours out wickedness. Violence and destruction echo through her streets; sickness and wounds are always in front of me."

verses.kjv: Be thou instructed, O Jerusalem, lest my soul depart from thee; lest I make thee desolate, a land not inhabited.
verses.ct: "Accept correction, Jerusalem, or I will turn away from you. I will make you an empty wasteland where no one lives."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, They shall throughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine: turn back thine hand as a grapegatherer into the baskets.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD of hosts says: "They will pick through the remnant of Israel as thoroughly as someone harvesting a grapevine — reach your hand back into the branches again and again like a grape picker."

verses.kjv: To whom shall I speak, and give warning, that they may hear? behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken: behold, the word of the LORD is unto them a reproach; they have no delight in it.
verses.ct: Who can I speak to? Who can I warn that will actually listen? Look — their ears are closed and they can't pay attention. The word of the LORD is offensive to them; they want nothing to do with it.

verses.kjv: Therefore I am full of the fury of the LORD; I am weary with holding in: I will pour it out upon the children abroad, and upon the assembly of young men together: for even the husband with the wife shall be taken, the aged with him that is full of days.
verses.ct: So I am filled with the LORD's anger, and I am exhausted from holding it back. "Pour it out on the children in the streets and on the groups of young men alike. Both husband and wife will be captured, the elderly along with those who are very old.

verses.kjv: And their houses shall be turned unto others, with their fields and wives together: for I will stretch out my hand upon the inhabitants of the land, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: Their houses will be handed over to others, along with their fields and their wives, because I am going to raise my hand against everyone living in this land," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every one is given to covetousness; and from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.
verses.ct: "Everyone from the least important to the most powerful is greedy for dishonest profit. From prophets to priests, every one of them practices deception.

verses.kjv: They have healed also the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when there is no peace.
verses.ct: They treat the wounds of my people as if they were nothing serious, saying, 'Everything is fine, everything is fine!' — when nothing is fine at all.

verses.kjv: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore they shall fall among them that fall: at the time that I visit them they shall be cast down, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: Were they embarrassed when they did such disgusting things? No — they felt no shame whatsoever; they didn't even know how to blush. So they will collapse along with everyone else who falls. When I bring judgment on them, they will be brought down," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Stand ye in the ways, and see, and ask for the old paths, where is the good way, and walk therein, and ye shall find rest for your souls. But they said, We will not walk therein.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Stand at the crossroads and look around. Ask about the ancient paths — find out which way is the good road, and travel on it. Then you will find rest for your souls." But they replied, "We refuse to take that road."

verses.kjv: Also I set watchmen over you, saying, Hearken to the sound of the trumpet. But they said, We will not hearken.
verses.ct: I also appointed watchmen over you and said, "Listen for the sound of the trumpet!" But they replied, "We refuse to listen."

verses.kjv: Therefore hear, ye nations, and know, O congregation, what is among them.
verses.ct: So listen, you nations! Pay attention, you gathered peoples, to what is happening among them.

verses.kjv: Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, even the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not hearkened unto my words, nor to my law, but rejected it.
verses.ct: Listen, earth! I am about to bring disaster on this people — the consequences of their own schemes — because they have not listened to my words. They rejected my law completely.

verses.kjv: To what purpose cometh there to me incense from Sheba, and the sweet cane from a far country? your burnt offerings are not acceptable, nor your sacrifices sweet unto me.
verses.ct: What good is incense imported from Sheba to me, or fragrant spices from a distant land? Your burnt offerings do not please me, and your sacrifices give me no satisfaction.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will lay stumblingblocks before this people, and the fathers and the sons together shall fall upon them; the neighbour and his friend shall perish.
verses.ct: Therefore, this is what the LORD says: "Pay attention — I am placing obstacles in front of this people. Fathers and sons together will stumble over them; neighbors and friends will die."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Behold, a people cometh from the north country, and a great nation shall be raised from the sides of the earth.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Look — an army is coming from a northern land; a powerful nation is being mobilized from the far edges of the earth.

verses.kjv: They shall lay hold on bow and spear; they are cruel, and have no mercy; their voice roareth like the sea; and they ride upon horses, set in array as men for war against thee, O daughter of Zion.
verses.ct: They carry bows and spears. They are brutal and show no mercy. Their roar is like the crashing sea. They ride on horses, lined up in battle formation against you, daughter of Zion."

verses.kjv: We have heard the fame thereof: our hands wax feeble: anguish hath taken hold of us, and pain, as of a woman in travail.
verses.ct: We have heard reports about them, and our hands go limp with fear. Anguish grips us — pain like a woman in labor.

verses.kjv: Go not forth into the field, nor walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy and fear is on every side.
verses.ct: Don't go out into the fields! Don't walk along the roads! The enemy's sword is everywhere, and terror surrounds us on every side.

verses.kjv: O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation: for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us.
verses.ct: My people, put on rough cloth and roll in ashes. Mourn as you would for an only child — weep with the most bitter grief — because the destroyer will come against us suddenly.

verses.kjv: I have set thee for a tower and a fortress among my people, that thou mayest know and try their way.
verses.ct: "I have made you a tester of metals among my people, like a fortified watchpost, so that you can examine and evaluate their conduct."

verses.kjv: They are all grievous revolters, walking with slanders: they are brass and iron; they are all corrupters.
verses.ct: All of them are stubborn rebels who go around spreading slander. They are hard as bronze and iron; every one of them spreads corruption.

verses.kjv: The bellows are burned, the lead is consumed of the fire; the founder melteth in vain: for the wicked are not plucked away.
verses.ct: The bellows blow fiercely and the lead is consumed by the flames, but the refining is completely useless — the impurities are never removed.

verses.kjv: Reprobate silver shall men call them, because the LORD hath rejected them.
verses.ct: People will call them "rejected silver," because the LORD has rejected them.
